definition: to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need

sentences.english: Exported goods were exempted from the Consumption Tax.
Damps raises greatly is small, is nearly two automobile excise tax core goal.
sentences.chinese: 抑大扬小，是近两次汽车消费税的核心目标。

sentences.english: Mr Abe has studiously suppressed a debate about raising the consumption tax.
sentences.chinese: 安倍已然刻意地压制了一场关于提升消费税的争论。

sentences.english: He is also considering whether to raise the consumption tax to help pay for the clean-up.
sentences.chinese: 他也正在考虑要不要提高消费税来帮助偿清债务。

sentences.english: Last year the Howard government introduced the GST.
sentences.chinese: 去年何华德政府推出了消费税。

sentences.english: There is a question about whether we should try to have a progressive consumption tax.
sentences.chinese: 有一个关于我们是否应该采用累进消费税的问题。

sentences.english: Engine displacement is what they regulate in China- consumption tax is based on the displacement of the engine of the vehicle that’s being purchased.
sentences.chinese: 排气量是规范中国消费税的基本指标。

sentences.english: Recently, in the Czech Republic, there was a proposal to increase the excise tax on smoking.
sentences.chinese: 最近，捷克共和国，有一个增加香烟消费税的提案。

sentences.english: Another popular target is excise taxes on alcohol and tobacco.
sentences.chinese: 另一个流行的征税目标是消费税，酒和烟草税。

definition: not liable to taxation (of monastery, imperial family etc)/tax free/duty free (shop)
personal income tax (abbr. for 個人所得稅|个人所得税)
